title: Andy Cole sets goal challenge for Marcus Rashford at Man Utd
text:

Manchester United striker Marcus Rashford has been challenged to commit to becoming a goalscorer and score 20 goals or more by Andy Cole.

Two of Cole's former clubs, United and Newcastle , face off on Sunday with the Red Devils struggling for goals.

Rashford, tasked with leading the line after the departure of Romelu Lukaku, has scored three goals so far this season.

But Cole believes he needs to be pushing for 20 goals in order to prove he is capable of being United's centre forward.

Rashford's best return to date is a 13-goal season and Cole believes he needs to alter his style of play to focus more on finding the net.

(Image: Getty Images)

Cole said: “He doesn’t really enjoy it with his back to goal and he wants to pick it up and run at the defender.

“He is a super talent but he has to decide now what he wants to be.

“Does he want to be a goalscorer or does he want to play off the left or right?

(Image: Tony Spencer)

“He’s 21 so I’d like to believe he knows what his strongest position is.

“But if you are going to play as a centre forward for Manchester United , you have got to be looking to get yourself 20 goals.

“His best return in a season so far is 13 and if that is your best return, and you are the main striker, you are going to have to get yourself a few more.”
description: Former Man Utd striker Andy Cole has challenged Marcus Rashford to add more goals to his game
